main event: On June 3, 1956 in Petersburg, Indiana, a huge object resembling a blow torch was sighted traveling from south to north at approximately 500 feet, making no noise.
interesting points: The object initially appeared as a meteor traveling from southeast to northwest, then later appeared to be an aircraft on fire with pieces breaking off.
The speed of the object was too fast to be a commercial aircraft.
A member of the ground observer corps reported a low flying aircraft, possibly an F-80, in the Evansville area making low passes at an abandoned airstrip.
The report concludes that the sighting was likely a meteor based on the information provided.
The document is related to Project Blue Book, a U.S. Air Force program to investigate unidentified flying objects (UFOs).
sighted object: a huge object resembling a blow torch
